title: NetHack quaffing game
data:
The [NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack") (and [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM")!) **Quaffing Game** is a simple and enjoyable method to share the experience of the utterly delightful trials and tribulations of a solid game of NetHack with a group, locally, online and/or both!

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Disclaimer](#Disclaimer)

- [2 How to play (The short version)](#How_to_play_.28The_short_version.29)

  - [2.1 Helpful drinking game terminology](#Helpful_drinking_game_terminology)
  - [2.2 The ante (Creating a character)](#The_ante_.28Creating_a_character.29)
  - [2.3 Conducts](#Conducts)
  - [2.4 Incentives and penalties](#Incentives_and_penalties)
  - [2.5 Newbie](#Newbie)
  - [2.6 Common](#Common)
  - [2.7 Professional](#Professional)
  - [2.8 Hardcore](#Hardcore)
  - [2.9 The end?](#The_end.3F)
  - [2.10 Play again? \[ynq\]](#Play_again.3F_.5Bynq.5D)
  - [2.11 Mayor McCheese](#Mayor_McCheese)

#### Disclaimer

*The opinions expressed in this article are not the opinions of the NetHackWiki administration. Always play with [potions of fruit juice](/wiki/Potion_of_fruit_juice "Potion of fruit juice").*

### How to play (The short version)

1. Start a game of [NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack") or [Slash'EM](/wiki/Slash%27EM "Slash'EM") (or any other Hack [variant](/wiki/Variant "Variant")) by letting [RNG](/wiki/RNG "RNG") choose your [character](/wiki/Player "Player") for you ("y" at the prompt).
2. Take one drink of your beverage.
3. Take two more drinks of your beverage for not choosing a [conduct](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct") to follow and announce that you're a turnip.
4. Whenever your [character](/wiki/Player "Player") [quaffs](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff") something, take a drink.
5. Whenever your [character](/wiki/Player "Player") gains a [level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level"), say "paxed!" and give out one drink.
6. For additional fun, use the newbie level [incentives and penalties](/wiki/Nethack_Quaffing_Game#Incentives_and_penalties "Nethack Quaffing Game").
7. Strive for a high score! When "You [die](/wiki/Death "Death")..." pay the penalty, reminisce for a few, and play again!
8. When you're ready, look into the more difficult [incentives and penalties](/wiki/Nethack_Quaffing_Game#Incentives_and_penalties "Nethack Quaffing Game")!

[RNG](/wiki/RNG "RNG") Speed, young hacker!

#### Helpful drinking game terminology

If you are unfamiliar with the average rules of a drinking game, the following terminology will benefit you greatly.

- Drink: A sip of your beverage. Not an entire container of beverage, or even an entire glass (large or small) of beverage. Just a solid sip.
- Give drink: Politely request that someone else playing the game take a drink of the beverage they are drinking.
- Take drink: Take a drink of your beverage.

That's not so hard, is it? Ante up, [McCheese](/wiki/Nethack_Quaffing_Game#Mayor_McCheese "Nethack Quaffing Game").

#### The ante (Creating a character)

To play the NetHack quaffing game, you must take 1 drink of your beverage. Do so now, just to get in the habit. You'll be required to take your official drink when you actually start the game.

If you let [RNG](/wiki/RNG "RNG") choose your character for you, continue to the next section without drinking any further. If you choose your own character, drink 5 times, plus the 1 drink for playing. That's 6 drinks [McCheese](/wiki/Nethack_Quaffing_Game#Mayor_McCheese "Nethack Quaffing Game"). These character creation drinks are referred to as your "ante". Remember your ante!

#### [Conducts](/wiki/Conducts "Conducts")

Now that you have appeared in the dungeon, take a look at your inventory before moving. Decide which [conducts](/wiki/Conducts "Conducts") and [unofficial conducts](/wiki/Unofficial_conducts "Unofficial conducts") you wish to participate in. If you choose not to participate in any [conducts](/wiki/Conducts "Conducts") or [unofficial conducts](/wiki/Unofficial_conducts "Unofficial conducts"), take two drinks and announce to the room that you are a turnip.

For each level gained while retaining any [unofficial conducts](/wiki/Unofficial_conducts "Unofficial conducts") *besides Survivor and Celibacy*, give out one drink. This only applies to levels gained for the first time each game (see the [level drain penalty](/wiki/Nethack_Quaffing_Game#Professional "Nethack Quaffing Game")).

Only the following official [conducts](/wiki/Conducts "Conducts") apply to this rule:

- [Foodless](/wiki/Foodless "Foodless")
- [Pacifist](/wiki/Pacifist "Pacifist")
- [Illiterate](/wiki/Illiterate "Illiterate")
- [Atheist](/wiki/Atheist "Atheist")

If a player ever violates a conduct he has given drinks to other players for pursuing, he must immediately take five drinks and pursue the Inventoryless [unofficial conduct](/wiki/Unofficial_conducts "Unofficial conducts") for the remainder of that game in addition to other conducts he/she is pursuing. (Yes, this means dropping everything you are carrying, except your blindfold if Zen.) Any further conduct violations result in 5+*v* drinks, where *v* is the number of total violations that game.

#### Incentives and penalties

During the course of a game, interesting events will befall every hacker. In honor of these events, the NetHack quaffing game seeks to reward and punish the recipients and perpetrators of said events by allowing them to give out drinks or suggesting kindly that they take drinks based on the actual event that transpires. The most basic, easiest to remember and thus mandatory of these rules is that when your character [quaffs](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff"), you must quaff. As for the rest, examine the tables below! If something interesting happens to you that isn't on the list, please mention it in [#slashem](/wiki/Libera "Libera") so future quaffing hackers can "benefit" from your experience!

#### Newbie

| Newbie incentives                                                                                                                                             | Result       |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ |
| Say "paxed!" immediately after you [level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") up                                                                      | Give 1 drink |
| [Eat](/wiki/Eat "Eat") a [hobbit](/wiki/Hobbit "Hobbit") [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse"), or a [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") of [hobbit](/wiki/Hobbit "Hobbit") meat | Give 1 drink |
| You feel a [mild buzz](/wiki/Newt "Newt")                                                                                                                     | Give 1 drink |
| Discover the [BUC](/wiki/BUC "BUC") status of an item by having it [curse](/wiki/Curse "Curse") you                                                           | Give 1 drink |
| Narrowly avoid [death](/wiki/Death "Death")                                                                                                                   | Give 1 drink |
| [Zap](/wiki/Zap "Zap") yourself with an [unidentified](/wiki/BUC "BUC") [wand](/wiki/Wand "Wand") (once per wand)                                             | Give 1 drink |
| [Wear](/wiki/Wear "Wear") an [unidentified](/wiki/BUC "BUC") [amulet](/wiki/Amulet "Amulet") (once per amulet)                                                | Give 1 drink |

| Newbie penalties                                                                                                                                                                                                            | Result        |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------- |
| Choosing your own [character](/wiki/Player "Player")                                                                                                                                                                        | Take 5 drinks |
| You [die](/wiki/Death_\(character\) "Death (character)")...                                                                                                                                                                 | Take 2 drinks |
| [Quaff](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff") something                                                                                                                                                                                      | Take 1 drink  |
| [Faint](/wiki/Fainting "Fainting") from [hunger](/wiki/Hunger "Hunger")                                                                                                                                                     | Take 1 drink  |
| Hurt your [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet")                                                                                                                                                                                            | Take 1 drink  |
| Cast [Identify](/wiki/Identify "Identify")                                                                                                                                                                                  | Take 1 drink  |
| [Drink](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff") from a [fountain](/wiki/Fountain "Fountain")                                                                                                                                                   | Take 1 drink  |
| [Zap](/wiki/Zap "Zap") a beneficial [wand](/wiki/Wand "Wand")                                                                                                                                                               | Take 1 drink  |
| Heal yourself with a [wand](/wiki/Wand "Wand"), [spell](/wiki/Spell "Spell"), [potion](/wiki/Potion "Potion"), [ring of regeneration](/wiki/Ring_of_regeneration "Ring of regeneration") or [prayer](/wiki/Prayer "Prayer") | Take 1 drink  |

#### Common

| Common incentives                                                                                                                                   | Result                   |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------ |
| [Quaff](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff") a [potion of booze](/wiki/Potion_of_booze "Potion of booze")                                                           | Give 1 drink to everyone |
| Gain a [level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") while following a [conduct](/wiki/Nethack_Quaffing_Game#Conducts "Nethack Quaffing Game") | Give 1 drink             |
| [Throw](/wiki/Throw "Throw") a [potion of healing](/wiki/Potion_of_healing "Potion of healing") at a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster")             | Give 2 drinks            |
| Purposefully [wear](/wiki/Wear "Wear") a [cursed](/wiki/Cursed "Cursed") [blindfold](/wiki/Blindfold "Blindfold") (or [towel](/wiki/Towel "Towel")) | Give 2 drinks            |
| Destroy a [player](/wiki/Player "Player")'s [ghost](/wiki/Ghost "Ghost")                                                                            | Give 1 drink             |
| [Eat](/wiki/Eat "Eat") a [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") that smells unfamiliar                                                                              | Give 2 drinks            |
| Get frozen by a [floating eye](/wiki/Floating_eye "Floating eye")                                                                                   | Give 1 drink             |
| [Dig](/wiki/Dig "Dig") up a [grave](/wiki/Grave "Grave")                                                                                            | Give 1 drink             |
| Start [hallucinating](/wiki/Hallucinating "Hallucinating")                                                                                          | Give 1 drink             |
| Anger your [deity](/wiki/Deity "Deity")                                                                                                             | Give 2 drinks            |
| Kill your [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet")                                                                                                                    | Give 3 drinks            |
| Involuntarily get [lycanthropy](/wiki/Lycanthropy "Lycanthropy")                                                                                    | Give 1 drink             |

| Common penalties                                                                                                                   | Result                    |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------- |
| [Steal](/wiki/Shoplifting "Shoplifting") from a [shop](/wiki/Shop "Shop")                                                          | Take 2 drinks             |
| Cure [hallucination](/wiki/Hallucination "Hallucination")                                                                          | Take 1 drink              |
| Have one of your items stolen                                                                                                      | Take 1 drink              |
| Accidental [cannibalism](/wiki/Cannibalism "Cannibalism")                                                                          | Take 2 drinks             |
| [Pray](/wiki/Pray "Pray")                                                                                                          | Take 2 drinks             |
| [Die](/wiki/Death "Death") while [passing turns quickly](/wiki/Search "Search")                                                    | Take 1 (additional) drink |
| Take anything from a [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") level                                                                            | Take 1 drink              |
| Enchant an item                                                                                                                    | Take 3 drinks             |
| Realize you've got something wrong as (weapon in hand)                                                                             | Take 2 drinks             |
| [Quaff](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff") a [fountain](/wiki/Fountain "Fountain") and thereby adjust your [statistics](/wiki/Ability "Ability") | Take 3 drinks             |
| Kill a [unicorn](/wiki/Unicorn "Unicorn")                                                                                          | Take 2 drinks             |
| [Quaff](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff") a [potion of oil](/wiki/Potion_of_oil "Potion of oil")                                                | Take 2 drinks             |
| Become engulfed                                                                                                                    | Take 2 drinks             |

#### Professional

| "Professional" incentives                                                                                                  | Result                                           |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------ |
| Equip an [amulet of strangulation](/wiki/Amulet_of_strangulation "Amulet of strangulation") and survive                    | Give 1 drink                                     |
| Dry up a [Minetown](/wiki/Minetown "Minetown") [fountain](/wiki/Fountain "Fountain")                                       | Give 2 drinks                                    |
| Donate items to a [shop](/wiki/Shop "Shop") without receiving payment from the [shopkeeper](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper") | Give 1 drink (maximum 1 drink per shop per game) |
| Aggravate a [shopkeeper](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper")                                                                    | Give 1 drink                                     |
| Aggravate [the Oracle](/wiki/Oracle_\(monster\) "Oracle (monster)")                                                        | Give 2 drinks                                    |
| Aggravate an [aligned priest](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest")                                                       | Give 2 drinks                                    |
| Purposeful [cannibalism](/wiki/Cannibalism "Cannibalism")                                                                  | Give 1 drink                                     |
| Purposefully [faint](/wiki/Faint "Faint") from [hunger](/wiki/Hunger "Hunger")                                             | Give 1 drink                                     |
| Purposefully get [food poisoning](/wiki/Food_poisoning "Food poisoning")                                                   | Give 2 drinks                                    |
| Destroy your own [ghost](/wiki/Ghost "Ghost")                                                                              | Give 2 drinks                                    |
| Kill a [special monster](/wiki/Special_monster "Special monster")                                                          | Give 5 drinks                                    |
| Purposefully fail [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban")                                                                       | Give 4 drinks                                    |

| Professional penalties                                                                                         | Result                     |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------- |
| [Engrave](/wiki/Engrave "Engrave") [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth")                                       | Take 2 drinks              |
| Find an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact")                                                                  | Take 2 drinks              |
| Find a useful [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact")                                                            | Take 2 (additional) drinks |
| [Sit](/wiki/Sit "Sit") on a [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne")                                                    | Take 2 drinks              |
| [Polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") yourself                                                              | Take 2 drinks              |
| [Offer](/wiki/Offer "Offer") at an [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar")                                                | Take 1 drink               |
| Encounter a [wraith](/wiki/Wraith "Wraith")                                                                    | Take 1 drink               |
| Convert an [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") to your [alignment](/wiki/Alignment "Alignment")                       | Take 2 drinks              |
| [Monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") hatches from an [egg](/wiki/Egg "Egg") in your inventory                    | Take 1 drink               |
| [Pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet")[Dragon](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon") hatches from an [egg](/wiki/Egg "Egg") in your inventory | Take 3 drinks              |
| [Polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into something that can walk through walls                            | Take 3 drinks              |
| [Murder](/wiki/Murder "Murder") an NPC (Oracle, priests, shopkeepers and watchmen)                             | Take 5 drinks              |
| Get [blasted](/wiki/Artifact_blast "Artifact blast") by an artifact                                            | Take 2 drinks              |
| Lose a [level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level")                                                      | Take 2 drinks              |
| Get [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban") Spoilers                                                                | Take 5 drinks              |

#### Hardcore

| Hardcore incentives                                                                                                                                                 | Result         |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------- |
| Kill a co-aligned [unicorn](/wiki/Unicorn "Unicorn")                                                                                                                | Give 1 drink   |
| Purposefully [pray](/wiki/Pray "Pray") when your [god](/wiki/God "God") is angry                                                                                    | Give 1 drink   |
| Abandon your entire [inventory](/wiki/Inventory "Inventory") (only applicable after [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") 10 and only once) | Give 10 drinks |
| [Wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for something useless                                                                                                                     | Give 10 drinks |
| [Ascend](/wiki/Ascend "Ascend") naked and inventoryless (aside from the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor"))                              | Give 10 drinks |
| [Ascend](/wiki/Ascend "Ascend") on a public server                                                                                                                  | Give 10 drinks |

| Hardcore penalties                                                                           | Result         |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------- |
| [Pudding farm](/wiki/Farming "Farming")                                                      | Take 10 drinks |
| Use a [macro](/wiki/Macro "Macro")                                                           | Take 2 drinks  |
| [Wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for something useful                                               | Take 10 drinks |
| Write an unknown [scroll](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll") or [spellbook](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook") | Take 5 drinks  |
| Finish the [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest")                                                      | Take 10 drinks |
| Ask for [help](/wiki/Libera "Libera")                                                        | Take 5 drinks  |
| [Ascend](/wiki/Ascend "Ascend") ["properly geared"](/wiki/Ascension_kit "Ascension kit")     | Take 10 drinks |
| [Ascend](/wiki/Ascend "Ascend") as Mayor McCheese                                            | Take 10 drinks |
| [Ascend](/wiki/Ascend "Ascend") on a local game                                              | Take 10 drinks |

#### The end?

[Die](/wiki/Death_\(character\) "Death (character)") (or [win](/wiki/Ascension "Ascension"))! If you've fallen in battle (even if your life gets saved somehow) you drink twice to mourn your loss. Feel free to drink more than twice, dying can be rough.

For each [conduct](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct") (official or unofficial) retained unbroken upon death or ascension, give out 1 drink.

If an ascension occurs, the ascending player first pays triple their ante fee, plus any other drinks deemed reasonable/necessary by the other players (non-negotiable). Then, for the remainder of the evening, the ascended player may want only deliver drinks to anyone, as they are a [demigod](/wiki/Demigod "Demigod") and that's how it goes.

To play again, simply pay your previous ante cost plus your new ante cost. To clarify, if you paid 5 drinks on your first character and are paying 1 drink on your next character (more common than you might think) you take 6 drinks, but your ante for this round is 1. Next run, you pay 1 for your last ante and whatever your current ante cost might be. That way we don't have too many Mayors McCheese strolling around and upsetting the citizenry.

#### Play again? \[ynq]

To play again, simply pay your previous ante cost plus your new ante cost. To clarify, if you paid 6 on your first character and are getting ready to pay 1 for your second character (more common than you might think) you take 7 drinks, but your ante for the second round is 1. Round 3, you pay 1 for your last ante and whatever your current ante cost might be.

#### Mayor McCheese

The term "Mayor McCheese" designates someone who plays the NetHack Quaffing Game (or even [NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack") itself) with the intent to bend the odds in their own favor to some degree, large or small. Perhaps because the NetHack Quaffing Game is nothing short of [RNG](/wiki/RNG "RNG") worship, even selecting your own race/role/gender/alignment is action considered grounds for instant mayoral election. "Mayors McCheese" (as they are called plurally) pay quite a bit more drinks to play than your average nameless hacker as a consequence of the burdens of cheesy office. See the ante section for more information on the costs (in drinks quaffed, silly!) to play the NetHack Quaffing Game.

To clarify, if you paid 6 on your first character and are getting ready to pay 1 for your second character (more common than you might think) you take 7 drinks, but your ante for the second round is 1. Round 3, you pay 1 for your last ante and whatever your current ante cost might be.

Mayor McCheese

The term "Mayor McCheese" designates someone who plays the NetHack Quaffing Game (or even NetHack itself) with the intent to bend the odds in their own favor to some degree, large or small. Perhaps because the NetHack Quaffing Game is nothing short of RNG worship, even selecting your own race/role/gender/alignment is action considered grounds for instant mayoral election. "Mayors McCheese" (as they are called plurally) pay quite a bit more drinks to play than your average nameless hacker as a consequence of the burdens of cheesy office. See the ante section for more information on the costs (in drinks quaffed, silly!) to play the NetHack Quaffing Game.

The [[NetHack]] (and [[SLASH'EM]]!) '''Quaffing Game''' is a simple and enjoyable method to share the experience of the utterly delightful trials and tribulations of a solid game of NetHack with a group, locally, online and/or both!

==== Disclaimer ====
''The opinions expressed in this article are not the opinions of the NetHackWiki administration. Always play with [[potion of fruit juice|potions of fruit juice]].''

=== How to play (The short version) ===
# Start a game of [[NetHack]] or [[Slash'EM]] (or any other Hack [[variant]]) by letting [[RNG]] choose your [[player|character]] for you ("y" at the prompt).
# Take one drink of your beverage.
# Take two more drinks of your beverage for not choosing a [[conduct]] to follow and announce that you're a turnip.
# Whenever your [[player|character]] [[quaff|quaffs]] something, take a drink.
# Whenever your [[player|character]] gains a [[experience level|level]], say "paxed!" and give out one drink.
# For additional fun, use the newbie level [[Nethack Quaffing Game#Incentives and penalties|incentives and penalties]].
# Strive for a high score!  When "You [[death|die]]..." pay the penalty, reminisce for a few, and play again!
# When you're ready, look into the more difficult [[Nethack Quaffing Game#Incentives and penalties|incentives and penalties]]!

[[RNG]] Speed, young hacker!

==== Helpful drinking game terminology ====
If you are unfamiliar with the average rules of a drinking game, the following terminology will benefit you greatly.
*Drink: A sip of your beverage. Not an entire container of beverage, or even an entire glass (large or small) of beverage. Just a solid sip.
*Give drink:  Politely request that someone else playing the game take a drink of the beverage they are drinking.
*Take drink:  Take a drink of your beverage.
That's not so hard, is it? Ante up, [[Nethack Quaffing Game#Mayor McCheese|McCheese]].

==== The ante (Creating a character) ====
To play the NetHack quaffing game, you must take 1 drink of your beverage. Do so now, just to get in the habit. You'll be required to take your official drink when you actually start the game.

If you let [[RNG]] choose your character for you, continue to the next section without drinking any further. If you choose your own character, drink 5 times, plus the 1 drink for playing. That's 6 drinks [[Nethack Quaffing Game#Mayor McCheese|McCheese]]. These character creation drinks are referred to as your "ante". Remember your ante!

==== [[Conducts]] ====
Now that you have appeared in the dungeon, take a look at your inventory before moving. Decide which [[conducts]] and [[unofficial conducts]] you wish to participate in. If you choose not to participate in any [[conducts]] or [[unofficial conducts]], take two drinks and announce to the room that you are a turnip.

For each level gained while retaining any [[unofficial conducts]] ''besides Survivor and Celibacy'', give out one drink. This only applies to levels gained for the first time each game (see the [[Nethack Quaffing Game#Professional|level drain penalty]]).

Only the following official [[conducts]] apply to this rule:
* [[Foodless]]
* [[Pacifist]]
* [[Illiterate]]
* [[Atheist]]

If a player ever violates a conduct he has given drinks to other players for pursuing, he must immediately take five drinks and pursue the Inventoryless [[unofficial conducts|unofficial conduct]] for the remainder of that game in addition to other conducts he/she is pursuing. (Yes, this means dropping everything you are carrying, except your blindfold if Zen.) Any further conduct violations result in 5+''v'' drinks, where ''v'' is the number of total violations that game.

==== Incentives and penalties ====
During the course of a game, interesting events will befall every hacker. In honor of these events, the NetHack quaffing game seeks to reward and punish the recipients and perpetrators of said events by allowing them to give out drinks or suggesting kindly that they take drinks based on the actual event that transpires. The most basic, easiest to remember and thus mandatory of these rules is that when your character [[quaff]]s, you must quaff. As for the rest, examine the tables below! If something interesting happens to you that isn't on the list, please mention it in [[Libera|#slashem]] so future quaffing hackers can "benefit" from your experience!

==== The end? ====
[[Death (character)|Die]] (or [[ascension|win]])! If you've fallen in battle (even if your life gets saved somehow) you drink twice to mourn your loss. Feel free to drink more than twice, dying can be rough.

For each [[conduct]] (official or unofficial) retained unbroken upon death or ascension, give out 1 drink.

If an ascension occurs, the ascending player first pays triple their ante fee, plus any other drinks deemed reasonable/necessary by the other players (non-negotiable). Then, for the remainder of the evening, the ascended player may want only deliver drinks to anyone, as they are a [[demigod]] and that's how it goes.

To play again, simply pay your previous ante cost plus your new ante cost. To clarify, if you paid 5 drinks on your first character and are paying 1 drink on your next character (more common than you might think) you take 6 drinks, but your ante for this round is 1. Next run, you pay 1 for your last ante and whatever your current ante cost might be. That way we don't have too many Mayors McCheese strolling around and upsetting the citizenry.
